0.title: Celebrities call out Kanye West for 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week
0.article_body: After Kanye West wore a 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week, Jaden tweeted, "Black Lives Matter." Rapper Boosie tweeted, "Damn @kanyewest you just going to keep using your platform to s**t on your own race like this?...Do us a favour and bleach your skin all white." Supermodel Linda Evangelista wrote, "Black. Lives. Matter. Today, fashion made me sad."

1.title: Man, his 3 aides arrested for daylight murder of 35-yr-old woman in K'taka
1.article_body: Karnataka Police arrested a man and his three aides for allegedly murdering a 35-year-old Muslim woman in Gadag in daylight on the road. Initially, it was reported the murder was a hate crime as she had converted to Islam. Police later clarified that the man, along with his friends, had decided to kill the woman to avenge his brother's murder.

2.title: Tesla to remove more sensors from cars amid autopilot scrutiny
2.article_body: As Tesla faces autopilot scrutiny, it will only use cameras in its safety and driver-assistant features and will remove ultrasonic sensors from vehicles starting this month. As of now, Tesla vehicles have 12 ultrasonic sensors on the front and rear bumpers along with short-range sound sensors that are mainly used to detect close objects and while parking.

3.title: Can you buy Twitter & then delete it: Musk's ex-wife Talulah to him in a text
3.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's text messages with his ex-wife and actress Talulah Riley regarding Twitter have also become public. In one of the messages dated March 23, Talulah wrote to Musk, "Can you buy Twitter and then delete it, please!?" In another, she wrote, "Please do something to fight woke-ism...I will do anything to help! xx."

4.title: 78-yr-old man marries 18-yr-old girl in Philippines; pics go viral
4.article_body: A 78-year-old man in the Philippines has married an 18-year-old girl, with pictures from the ceremony going viral on social media. Rashed Mangacop met Halima Abdullah three years ago at a dinner party in the Cagayan province. "It was not an arranged marriage and the couple came together purely out of love," Rashed's nephew, Ben Mangacop, said.

5.title: Wonderful piece of art: Nagarjuna on Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'
5.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna congratulated Mani Ratnam for 'Ponniyin Selvan' and called the film a "wonderful piece of art". "'Ponniyin Selvan' had always been his dream. He had talked about it to me quite a few times," Nagarjuna said. The actor added that he's seen Mani Ratnam's journey as a filmmaker and recalled his "fond memories" of working with him in 'Gitanjali'.

6.title: Tracxn Technologies fixes price band at ₹75-₹80 for October 10 IPO
6.article_body: Tracxn﻿ Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, has set its price band at ₹75-₹80 apiece for its initial public offering. Tracxn's IPO will be open for subscription from October 10-12 and comprise an offer for sale of 3,86,72,208 equity shares by promoters and shareholders. Tracxn Co-founders Abhishek Goyal and Neha Singh will offload up to 76,62,655 equity shares each.

7.title: 2 friends drown in Hyderabad's Nanajipur waterfalls, bodies recovered
7.article_body: Two friends who went for a picnic at Nanajipur waterfalls located near Hyderabad’s Shamshabad drowned on Monday. The incident took place when 30-year-old Kammari Mahendhar Chary and his 19-year-old friend Md Nadeem entered the water to swim, Shamshabad police said. Later, with the help of expert swimmers, police retrieved their bodies.

8.title: Ugandan Prez fires son from military role after Kenya invasion tweet
8.article_body: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni fired his son, Muhoozi Kainerugaba, as commander of the country's infantry forces after his son tweeted that it wouldn't take him and his army two weeks to capture Kenya's capital Nairobi. However, Uganda's military said that Kainerugaba has been promoted from Lieutenant General to full general and would remain a senior presidential adviser for special operations.

9.title: Felt like setting my younger self free: Lil Nas X on wearing skirt at a show
9.article_body: Singer Lil Nas X said he felt like he was setting his "younger self free" when he walked on the stage of one of his shows wearing a skirt. "Afterwards, my family...told me they were really proud. I feel like I'm changing some minds," he added. The singer said style is "a way to show people who you are".

10.title: Delhi man, held last year, arrested again with 300 kg banned firecrackers
10.article_body: Police arrested a 43-year-old man in possession of 300 kilograms of illegal firecrackers in Delhi's Shyam Vihar area. "It was also revealed...the same person was arrested last year in the same season while selling the banned firecrackers," police said. "The accused disclosed...he had procured firecrackers from Gurugram and was selling at higher rates to earn huge profit," police added.

11.title: Police raid illegal parking lot in Gurugram Sector 48, 2 booked
11.article_body: The Gurugram Police and Chief Minister's flying squad booked two people for allegedly running an illegal parking lot during a joint raid in Sector 48. The parking lot was being run by encroaching on Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) land. The CM's flying squad has identified at least 20 places in Gurugram where groups are running illegal paid parking lots.

12.title: India reports 2,468 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 33,318
12.article_body: India reported 2,468 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in the country stand at 33,318. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,733. This comes a day after India reported 1,968 cases, the lowest daily rise in the number of fresh COVID-19 cases since May.

13.title: I think the way Karthik batted, my no. 4 is in trouble: Suryakumar
13.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik for his 46-run innings, which included four boundaries and as many sixes, in the third T20I against South Africa, Suryakumar Yadav said, "The way he batted, my number four is in trouble." Chasing South Africa's 228-run target, India lost Rohit and Shreyas early in the game and Karthik was promoted to bat at number four.

14.title: 4 terrorists killed in 2 encounters in J&K's Shopian: Police
14.article_body: Four local terrorists were killed in two separate encounters in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, Kashmir Zone Police tweeted on Wednesday. In the first encounter that broke out in the Drach area, three terrorists linked with Jaish-e-Mohammed were killed, said police. In the second encounter that took place in the Moolu area, one terrorist linked with Lashkar-e-Taiba was killed, added police.

15.title: There's no official candidate, says Tharoor ahead of Cong Presidential polls
15.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential polls, party leader Shashi Tharoor said it's quite unfair to create an impression that there is an "official candidate". "The party President and former President have assured me that there isn't and they are neutral," Tharoor added. "I don't know why some people are trying to create such an impression. It's not fair," he stated.

16.title: Ex-US marine jailed for 4.5 years in Russia for drunken attack
16.article_body: A former US Marine has been reportedly sentenced to four-and-half years in a Russian penal colony for attacking a police officer while drunk. Police removed Robert Gilman from a train following complaints from fellow passengers in January. He was then arrested for kicking an officer while in custody. Gilman said he has "apologised to Russia" and the police officer.

17.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performs 'Shastra Puja' on Dussehra, video surfaces
17.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performed 'Shastra Puja' at Auli Military Station in Chamoli, Uttarakhand on the occasion of Dussehra. "We're confident that our country is safe in the hands of our armed forces. India is the only country where 'puja' of weapons is performed," he said. Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande was also present during the ceremony.

18.title: Rohit bursts into laughter after calling Suryakumar's form a 'big concern', video viral
18.article_body: During the presentation ceremony following the third T20I against South Africa, India captain Rohit Sharma jokingly stated that the form of Suryakumar Yadav, who got out for 8(6), is a "big concern". Rohit then burst into laughter after making the sarcastic statement. "I thought that was least of your concerns," Murali Kartik commented. Suryakumar was named Player of the Series.

19.title: I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage: Melinda on divorce with Bill
19.article_body: Melinda French Gates in an interview spoke about her "unbelievably painful" divorce with ex-husband Bill. She said, "I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage anymore…But the odd thing about COVID is that it gave me the privacy to do what I needed to do." They announced their divorce in May 2021, after 27 years of marriage.

20.title: Pune woman cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in online gift fraud case
20.article_body: A Pune woman was cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in an online gift fraud case by a fraudster claiming to be a doctor in a foreign country, police said. The accused told her he had sent a gift but it had been seized by customs officials, police added. The woman transferred ₹3.23 lakh but never received the gift, police stated.

21.title: Traffic streamlined on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, 3 exits shut near Chipyana ROB
21.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has closed three exits near the newly constructed Chipyana rail overbridge to streamline the flow of traffic on Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME). The three exits, present within a distance of about two kilometres, were opened to ease traffic flow when the rail overbridge, which was the last pending structure on DME, was under construction.

22.title: Struggled with bat in 1st T20I, bowling in 2nd, but were clinical in 3rd: Bavuma
22.article_body: After their 49-run win in the third and final T20I against India, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, "A win like this is always good for confidence." He added, "We struggled with the bat in the first game, our bowling wasn't best in the last game, but we were clinical today." South Africa's Rilee Rossouw slammed 100*(48) in the game.

23.title: Nitish Kumar came to me begging after losing 2014 LS polls: Prashant Kishor
23.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar went to him "begging" after losing the 2014 Lok Sabha elections. "I assisted him in winning the 2015 Assembly polls as the chief ministerial candidate of the 'Mahagathbandhan'. Today, he has the temerity to offer 'gyan' (wisdom) to me," Kishor added.

24.title: 5 die as 4 cars, ambulance collide on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; video surfaces
24.article_body: At least five persons died following a collision between four cars and an ambulance on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link on Wednesday morning, Mumbai Police said. Earlier, it was reported that 10 persons got injured in the collision. Notably, the ambulance and other vehicles were preparing to take the victims of an earlier accident to a hospital.

25.title: LED TV explosion kills 16-year-old, creates massive hole in house wall in UP
25.article_body: A 16-year-old boy died after an LED TV exploded at his house in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The explosion, which injured the teen's mother, sister-in-law and a friend, left a massive hole in a wall of the house. "The explosion was so powerful, the entire house shook and parts of the wall collapsed," a family member said.

26.title: PM Modi greets people on Vijayadashami, wishes them positive energy
26.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted people on the occasion of Vijayadashami on Wednesday. "Many congratulations to all citizens on Vijayadashami, the symbol of victory. I wish that this auspicious occasion brings courage, restraint and positive energy in everyone's life," he tweeted. The PM is expected to participate in Kullu Dussehra celebrations in Himachal Pradesh today.

27.title: Crying at 9 am, video conferencing at 10 am: Melinda on working with Bill amid divorce
27.article_body: In an interview, Melinda French Gates spoke about working with Bill Gates amid their divorce. She said, "Even though I might be crying at 9 am and then have to be on a videoconference at 10 am with the person I'm leaving, I [had] to show up and be my best...I learned as a leader that I could do it."

28.title: Finally working with Karan Johar: Sara on 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'
28.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan is feeling blessed about collaborating with Karan Johar for her upcoming film 'Ae Watan Mere Watan', which was announced on October 4. "After all the magnanimity, friendship, advice, generosity and love - finally working with you, Karan Johar," she wrote.  Karan said he's excited to welcome Sara on board "to tell a powerful true story".

29.title: Imran Khan biggest liar on earth, he ruined country's economy: Pak PM
29.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has accused his predecessor Imran Khan of being "the biggest liar on the face of the earth". Sharif also alleged that Khan's policies had left the country's economy in "ruins". Talking to The Guardian, Sharif also accused Khan of "injecting poison" into society to "dangerously polarise the electorate" after he was ousted from power in April.

30.title: Youth kidnaps 11-year-old girl from Mumbai pandal, rapes her
30.article_body: A 19-year-old youth allegedly kidnapped an 11-year-old girl from a garba pandal in Mumbai and raped her. The victim had gone to the pandal with her sister, who made a quick trip home and when she returned, her sister was missing. The parents approached the police, who tracked down and arrested the suspect. He confessed he sexually assaulted the victim.

31.title: Delhi Police shares similarities between 'Dandiya' and 'Driving' in road safety tweet
31.article_body: A day before Dussehra, the Delhi Traffic Police shared a series of tweets to spread awareness about road safety rules. The traffic police posted an image stating similarities between 'Dandiya' with 'Driving' and shared it saying, "Ae Haalo Re Haalo! Road par GARBAd nahi karo, araam se chalo! (Don’t panic on the road, relax and drive)."

32.title: Bumrah's absence big loss, but also opportunity for someone else: Dravid
32.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has admitted Jasprit Bumrah's absence will be a "big loss" for the side in the T20 WC in Australia. Dravid, however, also added it's an opportunity for someone else to step up. On India's defeat in the third SA T20I, Dravid said, "[Had] Karthik and Pant continued for four-five overs more, it could've been closer."

33.title: Sriti Jha, Kili Paul to enter 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as wild cards
33.article_body: After Dutee Chand's voluntary exit from 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', the dance reality show will welcome Sriti Jha, Kili Paul, Nishant Bhat, and singer Ada Malik as wild card contestants. However, the Tanzanian social media creator will appear on the show for only a few episodes. Sriti and Nishant were last seen in Rohit Shetty's 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.

34.title: 'Ukraine will not conduct negotiations with Putin', Zelenskyy tells PM Modi on phone
34.article_body: During a phone call with PM Narendra Modi, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine will not conduct negotiations with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Zelenskyy said that all the aggressor's decisions aimed at attempting illegal annexation of Ukrainian territories do not change reality. He also emphasised the importance of PM Modi's recent statement that now is not the time for war.

35.title: Parts of Pune to face water cuts on Thursday due to repair work
35.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that water supply will be cut off in various parts of the city on Thursday due to repair work. The maintenance work will be carried out at Warje water works, Chandani Chowk water tank, Gandhi Bhavan, SNDT, Swargate etc. Water supply will be restored on Friday with low pressure, added the PMC.

36.title: Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app: Musk
36.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has proposed to proceed with his original offer of $44 billion to acquire Twitter. Soon after, Musk tweeted, "Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app." While he didn't explain what 'X app' could entail, he added, "Twitter probably accelerates X by 3 to 5 years, but I could be wrong."

37.title: Mumbai local trains decorated amid Dussehra, pics surface
37.article_body: String decorations have been put up inside Mumbai local trains amid Dussehra celebrations and commuters shared pictures of the decorated train on social media. Last week, a video of a group of women performing Garba dance aboard a Mumbai local train also went viral on social media. The group of women performed Garba when the train reached Kalyan station.

38.title: Delhi withdraws ₹500 fine for not wearing masks in public
38.article_body: Delhi Disaster Management Authority has withdrawn the order imposing a fine of ₹500 for not wearing masks in public places from October 1. The services of health care workers hired on a contract basis in COVID-19 hospitals have been extended till the end of 2022, it added. Delhi on Tuesday reported 74 COVID-19 cases with a positivity rate of 1.07%.

39.title: Brad Pitt poured beer on our kids, choked one of them on private jet: Jolie
39.article_body: In a lawsuit filed on Tuesday, Angelina Jolie has alleged that Brad Pitt choked one of their children and hit another while on a private jet in 2016. Jolie also claimed that Pitt poured beer and red wine on the children. Jolie's lawyers filed the suit in the couple's legal battle over their French winery.

40.title: Twitter confirms receiving Musk's buyout offer, says will close at original price
40.article_body: Twitter confirmed that it has received Tesla CEO Elon Musk's letter for the buyout deal and said it "intends to close the transaction at $54.20 per share", the same price he agreed to in April. Musk's lawyers added that they'll proceed with the agreement if Delaware Chancery Court will "adjourn the trial and other proceedings related to the ongoing lawsuit".

41.title: 25 killed after bus carrying over 40 persons falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
41.article_body: At least 25 persons were killed after a bus carrying a wedding party of over 40 persons fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal on Tuesday night. "Police and SDRF rescued 21 people overnight; the injured have been admitted to nearby hospitals," Uttarakhand DGP Ashok Kumar said. The wedding procession left in bus from Laldhang, Haridwar SP City said.

42.title: US, South Korea fire 4 missiles after North Korea fires missile over Japan
42.article_body: US and South Korea fired four ground-to-ground missiles into the Sea of Japan in response to North Korea firing a ballistic missile over Japan for the first time in five years on Tuesday. The Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles hit mock targets, the South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff said. South Korea had called North Korea's launch a "provocation".

43.title: 71-yr-old man undergoes robotic-assisted surgery at Navi Mumbai hospital
43.article_body: A 71-year-old man underwent robotic-assisted surgery for treating bladder cancer at Apollo Hospital in Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. The surgery was carried out to remove his urinary bladder and prostate gland. "The advantages of robotically-assisted surgery are that it's minimally invasive and enables high surgical accuracy," a senior doctor at Apollo Hospital said. The man's condition is now stable.

44.title: Hyd Police issue traffic advisory for Durga Visarjan, TRS meet on Wed
44.article_body: Hyderabad Police have issued a traffic advisory for Wednesday. Owing to Telangana Rashtra Samithi meet, citizens coming from Masab Tank towards Banjara Hills Road Number 12 are requested to take alternative routes between 10 am-3 pm. Due to Durga Visarjan in Hussain Sagar from 4 pm, traffic coming from Khairatabad Flyover and Ambedkar statue won't be allowed towards NTR Marg.

45.title: JNU hostel room roof collapses; second such incident in 6 months
45.article_body: The ceiling of a hostel room at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) partially collapsed, making it the second such incident in the last six months. "Although there were no serious injuries to any resident, the residents of the room were sleeping nearby and the ceiling fell directly on their study table," said Swati Singh, President of the Democratic Students Federation (DSF).

46.title: Guard killed in Mumbai for not allowing consumption of alcohol in open plot
46.article_body: A 56-year-old man was arrested for killing a 75-year-old security guard after he refused him permission to consume alcohol in an open plot. The accused used to go to the plot often to consume alcohol but got irked when the victim asked him not to come. The victim and the accused knew each other.

47.title: 27-yr-old Gr Noida man held with 25 cartons of illegal firecrackers
47.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested with 25 cartons of illegal firecrackers in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. The accused had procured them from Delhi and wanted to sell them ahead of Diwali, police said, adding that the accused was arrested while transporting the firecrackers in a pickup truck.

48.title: BJP insulted voters of J&K: NC on Amit Shah's 'family rule' remark
48.article_body: Reacting to Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks about "family rule" in Jammu and Kashmir, National Conference (NC) spokesperson Imran Nabi Dar said BJP's rhetoric is an insult to lakhs of voters. Shah had stated that just three political families have ruled Jammu and Kashmir since independence. "It's unfortunate that this false narrative is being peddled time and again," Dar said.

49.title: Santosh, 1st woman to scale Mt Everest twice, to be chief guest at RSS event
49.article_body: The first woman to scale Mount Everest twice, Santosh Yadav, has been invited by the RSS as a chief guest at its annual Dussehra function in Nagpur on Wednesday. This will be the first time that a woman will be the chief guest at an RSS event, officials said. The Haryana-born mountaineer climbed Everest in May 1992 and May 1993.

50.title: Used car retailing unicorn Spinny launches ESOP for all employees
50.article_body: Used car retailing unicorn Spinny has launched an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) for all its employees. The plan is called 'Spinny Stock Option Plan for All', and will be available to all employees irrespective of role and designation, including blue-collar workers, the company said. In December last year, the Tiger Global-backed startup facilitated an ESOP buyback of $12 million.

51.title: India record their highest 9th wicket partnership in T20I cricket history
51.article_body: India recorded their highest partnership for the ninth wicket in T20I cricket history during the third T20I against South Africa in Indore. Deepak Chahar and Umesh Yadav shared a 48-run stand to set the record. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma and Zaheer Khan, who shared a 36-run stand against Australia in Bridgetown in 2010.

52.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Saturday, list released
52.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states till Saturday. It's very likely over Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha and Telangana on Wednesday and Thursday. It's very likely over Uttar Pradesh till Saturday, while it is likely over Madhya Pradesh till Friday. Andaman and Nicobar Islands may witness it from Thursday to Saturday.

53.title: Stimac to remain Indian men's football team head coach till Asian Cup 2023
53.article_body: Indian football head coach Igor Stimac has extended his contract until the end of the AFC Asian Cup 2023. The AIFF said if India advances to the quarterfinal stage of the tournament, the Croatian's contract will be automatically renewed. "I am extremely happy that the AIFF has placed the trust in the process that we have put in," said Stimac.

54.title: Billing startup Zenskar raises $3.5 mn led by Bessemer
54.article_body: Billing automation startup Zenskar has raised $3.5 million in a seed funding round led by Bessemer Venture Partners. The round also saw participation from Shine Capital, Basecamp Fund and Converge. Zenskar was founded in 2022 by Apurv Bansal and Saurabh Agrawal and it provides a billing software for SaaS companies to handle pricing complexities.

55.title: India's trade deficit widens to $26.72 billion in September, exports fall by 3.5%
55.article_body: According to preliminary data released by the commerce ministry, India's trade deficit widened to $26.72 billion, while exports decreased by 3.52% to $32.62 billion in September 2022. Sectors like engineering, ready-made garments of all textiles and rice saw a decline in exports in September. The merchandise export during the April-September 2022-23 period rose by 15.54% to $229.05 billion.

56.title: Kyrgios seeking assault case dismissal on mental health grounds: Report
56.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios is reportedly seeking to have his assault charge dismissed on mental health grounds. Kyrgios was charged with "common assault" in a "domestic relationship" for a January 2021 incident involving his former girlfriend. In February 2022, Kyrgios said he battled depression and substance abuse around the time of the 2019 Australian Open.

57.title: Tory MPs must unite behind PM Truss: UK's Indian-origin minister
57.article_body: UK's Indian-origin Home Secretary Suella Braverman on Tuesday criticised her Conservative Party colleagues for allegedly plotting a "coup" against Prime Minister Liz Truss. She said Tory MPs should unite behind their leader. Braverman's remarks came a day after the government reversed a proposed cut in income tax rate, following criticism from Conservative Party MPs.

58.title: Ukraine to bid along with Spain and Portugal to host 2030 FIFA WC: Report
58.article_body: Ukraine is reportedly set to join Spain and Portugal in a joint bid to host the 2030 football World Cup. The plan is said to have been sanctioned by Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy along with the governments of Spain and Portugal. The partnership is reportedly set to be announced during a press conference at the UEFA headquarters on Wednesday.

59.title: UP's Ram Baboo breaks national record in men's 35 km race walk
59.article_body: UP's Ram Baboo won the gold medal as he broke the national record in the men's 35 km race walk event at the National Games. Baboo, an unemployed physical education graduate, won the event in 2 hours 36 minutes 34 seconds, beating previous record holder, Haryana's Juned Khan. It is the fifth national record set at the Games so far.

60.title: Congress MLA Harshad Ribadiya resigns ahead of Gujarat polls
60.article_body: Congress MLA and Patidar community leader Harshad Ribadiya resigned from Gujarat Assembly membership on Tuesday. Speaker Nimaben Acharya accepted his resignation after she was convinced that he has resigned on his own and without any pressure, a statement by the state Assembly claimed. Ribadiya was an MLA from Visavadar in Junagadh district. This comes ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections.

61.title: HSBC board looking to sell Canada business: Report
61.article_body: According to a Sky News report, HSBC's board is looking to sell its operations in Canada. The HSBC board had reportedly directed JP Morgan's investment bankers to contact potential purchasers of the bank's domestic operations. According to an analyst, the value of HSBC's Canadian subsidiary could be in the region of $7 billion.

62.title: Piyush Goyal to meet export promotion councils on October 7
62.article_body: An official stated that Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will meet different export promotion councils on October 7 to discuss ways to promote the growth rate in the country's export shipments. Representatives from export bodies, including the Federation of Indian Export Organisations, Apparel Export Promotion Council and Council for Leather Exports, would participate in the meeting.

63.title: Rajasthan govt signs 4,192 MoUs ahead of Invest Summit 2022
63.article_body: The Rajasthan government signed 4,192 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) and Letters of Intent (LoIs), involving investment commitment worth ₹10.44 lakh crore ahead of Invest Rajasthan Summit 2022. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the MoUs and LoIs were signed between November last year and September this year. Out of them, 520 MoUs/LoIs have been executed, while 1,160 are under execution.

64.title: Pak were playing like kids, Eng hit them all over park: Ajmal
64.article_body: After Pakistan lost the series 4-3 against England, ex-spinner Saeed Ajmal said that the former played like "little kids". "England really hit Pakistan all over the park," Ajmal said. He added, "These guys play well in one match and then fail in 10. It's better if you play unfit...players instead...[They] play in fear over their spot in the XI."

65.title: 52-yr-old man killed, another injured in elephant attack in Maha
65.article_body: A 52-year-old man was killed and another man was injured in an attack by a wild elephant in Navegaon Bandh range of Maharashtra's Gondia on Tuesday, a forest official said. The incident occurred when 20 to 25 persons from Tidka village ventured close to a herd of 23 elephants to keep it away from their paddy crop, the official said.

66.title: Pakistani drone spotted in Punjab's Gurdaspur, BSF opens fire
66.article_body: A drone from Pakistan was spotted along the India-Pakistan international border in Punjab's Gurdaspur sector on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, officials said. Border Security Force (BSF) troops opened fire at the object, following which it was reportedly forced to fly back to Pakistan. Officials launched search operations to check if it dropped any packages in Indian territory.

67.title: BillDesk to sue PayU-parent Prosus for terminating $4.7-bn deal: Report
67.article_body: Indian online payments gateway BillDesk is preparing to sue PayU-parent Prosus after it terminated a $4.7-billion acquisition deal, Moneycontrol reported. The deal, which was set to be Indian fintech sector's largest acquisition, was terminated on Monday, nearly a month after CCI approved it. PayU's executives in India were reportedly informed of the termination hours before the announcement.

68.title: ITF working with WTA on 2023 calendar after Swiatek pulls out of BJK Cup
68.article_body: After Iga Swiatek opted to skip Billie Jean King Cup Finals, International Tennis Federation(ITF), world tennis governing body, said it'll work with the women's body(WTA) on 2023 schedule to ensure players can compete in both the events. "ITF is sorry that...Swiatek is unable to take part," said ITF President David Haggerty. The world number one withdrew due to scheduling issues.

69.title: EV startup Euler Motors raises $60M in Series C round
69.article_body: Electric vehicle startup ﻿Euler Motors﻿ said it has raised $60 million in a Series C funding round led by ﻿GIC﻿ Singapore. Blume Ventures﻿, ﻿Athera Venture Partners﻿, ﻿QRG Holdings﻿, ﻿ADB Ventures﻿ and ﻿Moglix﻿ also participated in the round. Euler said the capital will be used to expand its manufacturing and supply chain infrastructure, and accelerate product development.

70.title: Stones hurled at Garba venue in MP; govt razes houses of 3 of 19 accused
70.article_body: Stones were hurled at a Garba event in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur following a dispute between two groups. SP Anurag Sujania said illegal construction, belonging to three of 19 accused, spread over more than 4,500 square feet worth over ₹4.5 crore was demolished. Some accused persons are habitual offenders, Sujania said, adding that seven of them were detained following a probe.

71.title: CESL selects agencies to set up 124 battery swapping stations for EVs
71.article_body: Convergence Energy Services Limited (CESL) said that it has selected agencies to establish 124 battery swapping stations and 352 standing chargers for electric two and three-wheelers. CESL added that the agencies will also install 1,294 standing DC fast chargers for electric four-wheelers. CESL CEO Mahua Acharya said adequate charging infrastructure is a necessity to scale-up electric mobility.

72.title: Bombay Dyeing board approves ₹940 crore rights issue draft
72.article_body: Bombay Dyeing & Manufacturing Company, in a BSE filing, said that its rights issue committee has approved the draft letter of offer for the proposed ₹940 crore. The draft letter of the offer, dated October 3, 2022, will be submitted to the National Stock Exchange of India, Bombay Stock Exchange, and the Securities and Exchange Board of India.

73.title: Grid failure leaves 130 million people without power in Bangladesh
73.article_body: Around 130 million people were without electricity in Bangladesh on Tuesday after a power grid failure, the government said. More than 80% of Bangladesh was affected by the power outage after 2 pm local time, the Power Development Board said. Only some regions in the country's northwest had electricity.

74.title: India suffer their worst-ever defeat on home soil in T20I cricket, lose to South Africa
74.article_body: South Africa defeated India by 49 runs in the third T20I in Indore to hand them their worst defeat (by runs) on Indian soil in T20I history. India's previous worst T20I defeat at home came on March 15, 2016, when New Zealand defeated them by 47 runs in Nagpur. South Africa scored 227/3 today, their highest-ever T20I total against India.

75.title: The more I raped, murdered onscreen, the more I got close to my family: Govvind
75.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has said playing negative characters onscreen changed his personality in a good way. "The more I raped, murdered...onscreen, the more I got close to my family," he added. "Because the thought of someone being so cruel used to...trigger me...I used to question myself on how someone can be so bad as to rape or commit...crime," Govvind said.

76.title: I don't associate Ramayan with VFX: 'Ramayan' actress Dipika on 'Adipurush'
76.article_body: Actress Dipika Chikhlia, who portrayed Sita in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', spoke about the teaser of 'Adipurush' and said, "I don't associate Ramayan with VFX, that's my personal take on this." She added that Ramayan is a story of truth and morality. Directed by Om Raut, 'Adipurush' stars Prabhas, Saif Ali Khan, Kriti Sanon and Sunny Singh.

77.title: Ready to contribute to peace efforts in Ukraine: Modi tells Zelenskyy
77.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in a telephonic conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said that India is ready to contribute to the peace efforts in Ukraine. "PM also reiterated the importance of respecting the UN Charter, International Law, and the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all states," as per a statement by the PMO. Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

78.title: Rahul Gandhi condoles death of 10 mountaineers in U'khand avalanche
78.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi offered condolences to the families of those who were killed in an avalanche in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Tuesday and called the incident "distressing". "Praying for the safe return of those missing and speedy recovery of those injured," Rahul Gandhi said. Ten trainee mountaineers were killed in the avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak.

79.title: They still look very young: Ayesha on 90s co-stars romancing young actresses
79.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka said in an interview that she doesn't have any problem with the fact that the actors who starred opposite her in the 90s are still romancing women who're in their 20s on the screen. She said they still look very young on screen. "All of them still look like they're 20, so credit goes there," Ayesha added.

80.title: PM Modi condoles death of Vadodara road accident victims
80.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the death of the victims who were involved in a road accident in Gujarat's Vadodara. PM Modi announced ₹2 lakh ex gratia from the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund (PMNRF) for the family of each of the deceased. He also announced ₹50,000 for those who were injured in the accident.

81.title: 5G launch in India to help other developing economies: Qualcomm CEO
81.article_body: Qualcomm President and CEO Cristiano Amon on Tuesday said that the launch of 5G services in India will be a "catalytic event" in terms of scaling up the technology. He said 5G launch will enable its proliferation in other developing economies across Latin America, Southeast Asia and Middle East. Notably, PM Narendra Modi launched 5G services in India on Saturday.

82.title: Kremlin praises Elon Musk for Twitter poll on Russia-Ukraine war
82.article_body: Russia on Tuesday praised Tesla CEO Elon Musk for suggesting a peace deal in the Russia-Ukraine war. "It is very positive that somebody like Elon Musk is looking for a peaceful way out of this situation," Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Earlier, Musk conducted a Twitter poll with a possible ending of violence.

83.title: People getting liquor from Goa to face MCOCA charges: Maha Minister
83.article_body: Maharashtra Excise Minister Shambhuraj Desai has directed officials of the department to invoke the Maharashtra Control Of Organised Crime Act against people "bringing even one bottle of liquor from Goa". He told the officials to send those smuggling liquor to the police administration. Desai also asked authorities to set up temporary checkpoints on the smaller routes between Goa and Sindhudurg.

84.title: Musk proposes to buy Twitter at the original price of $54.20 a share: Report
84.article_body: The world's richest man and Tesla's CEO Elon Musk is proposing to buy Twitter at $54.20 a share, the original price he proposed for its acquisition, Bloomberg reported. Twitter shares jumped over 12% on the news, after trading was briefly halted. This comes ahead of Musk and Twitter set to enter the courtroom over Musk backing out of the deal.

85.title: Gold-supplying banks cut back shipments to India, focus on China, Turkey: Report
85.article_body: Gold-supplying banks have cut back shipments to India ahead of major festivals in favour of focussing on China, Turkey, and other markets where better premiums are offered, Reuters reported. India's gold imports in September fell 30% from a year ago to 68 tonnes, while Turkish gold imports soared 543%. China's net gold imports via Hong Kong jumped nearly 40%.

86.title: Hope 'Brahmāstra' trilogy will be monetary success for us: Johar
86.article_body: Speaking about the budget of 'Brahmāstra', producer Karan Johar has said that it is a "three-film budget". "There are a lot of assets and properties that were created that will move to film two and then film three," he added. "I'd like to believe...when all three films are made...it'll be a big monetary success for all of us," he added.

87.title: KCR brand ambassador of liquor: Cong after TRS leader distributes liquor, chicken
87.article_body: Congress leader Madhu Yashki on Tuesday criticised the ruling TRS and called Telangana CM KCR a "brand ambassador of liquor". "He not only drinks liquor but is also involved in...liquor scam," Yashki claimed. His comment comes after TRS leader Rajanala Srihari distributed liquor bottles and live chicken to public ahead of launch of a new party by CM KCR.

88.title: Female teachers fight before kids at govt school in UP; video viral
88.article_body: A video showing two-three female teachers getting into a physical fight and abusing each other in front of children at a government school in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur has gone viral on social media. The teachers, who were seen snatching phones from each other, have now been suspended. The incident reportedly took place during Gandhi Jayanti celebrations at Girls' Pre-Secondary School.

89.title: West engaging in nuclear rhetoric right now: Russia
89.article_body: Russia on Tuesday said it does not want to take part in "nuclear rhetoric" which was being spread by the West. UK-based The Times on Monday reported the NATO alliance believed Russia was going to conduct a nuclear test on the Ukrainian border. The West is "engaging in a lot" of "nuclear rhetoric right now", said Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov.

90.title: Edelweiss raises $425 mn for fund, targets $1 bn corpus
90.article_body: Edelweiss Alternative said that it has raised $425 million (₹3,400 crore) for its third 'Special Situations Fund' (SSF III) from large pension funds and insurance companies globally along with domestic high net individuals. The company said that it is targeting a corpus of $1 billion with a greenshoe option of $500 million. The fund has already invested ₹1,000 crore.

91.title: India trade deal may not have everything on services: UK Trade Minister
91.article_body: UK Trade Minister Kemi Badenoch said the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) between Britain and India might not contain everything the services sector wants. Speaking at Conservative Party's annual conference, she said, "We want something comprehensive, but it has to be right for both countries." She said any deal that was agreed upon could also be expanded at a later date.

92.title: Rajasthan BJP Prez starts campaign to open bank accounts for girls
92.article_body: Rajasthan BJP President Satish Poonia on Tuesday started a campaign to open bank accounts for girls under Centre's Sukanya Samriddhi Account Scheme. Poonia opened bank accounts for nine girls through funds from his salary as MLA. "Sukanya Samriddhi is a flagship scheme of the Modi government and girl children will be benefited from it," he said.

93.title: Saudi Arabia wins bid to host 2029 Asian Winter Games at Neom
93.article_body: Saudi Arabia will host 2029 Asian Winter Games at a planned mountain resort in the Gulf Arab state's $500 billion futuristic city project Neom. Olympic Council of Asia picked the Saudi candidacy that centres on Trojena that's planned to be a year-round ski resort by 2026. "Deserts...mountains  of Saudi Arabia will soon be a playground for Winter sports!" said OCA.

94.title: Bus carrying 45-50 people falls into gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal
94.article_body: A bus carrying 45-50 people fell into a gorge on the Rikhnikhal-Bironkhal road in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal on Tuesday. Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said State Disaster Response Force teams have reached the accident spot and local villagers are helping in the rescue operation. About 10 people have reportedly been injured and search operations are ongoing to find the others.

95.title: TikTok tracks users even if they don't use the app: Report
95.article_body: TikTok tracks people across the web even if they're not users of the app, The Independent reported citing a report by nonprofit organisation Consumer Reports. TikTok receives information including a person's IP address, web browsing habits and search history. The data "isn't used to group individuals into particular interest categories for other advertisers to target", a TikTok spokesperson said.

96.title: Tata Steel sells 19% equity stake in Oman-based mining arm AI Rimal
96.article_body: Tata Steel has sold its 19% equity stake in Oman-based limestone mining company Al Rimal Mining LLC to Oman National Investments Development Company (Tanmia), it informed the exchanges today. With this, Tata Steel's shareholding in its step-down subsidiary Al Rimal has been reduced from 70% to 51%. Other existing shareholders of Al Rimal will also sell their stake to Tanmia.

97.title: B'wood went through tough time with trolling & bashing: Karan Johar
97.article_body: Karan Johar has said that Bollywood went through a tough time with "trolling and bashing". "I, particularly, felt I was right at the centre of so much negativity," he added. Johar stated there were a lot of things written and said about him which was unfair. "It was not a nice time...It was something I never envisaged, imagined," he added.

98.title: Amit Sadh meets 'Entourage' actor Jeremy Piven, shares pic
98.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh recently met Golden Globe-winning actor Jeremy Piven in the US. Sharing a picture with the 'Entourage' actor on Instagram, Amit wrote, "Jeremy's portrayal of Ari Gold (Entourage) is one of the first few performances that inspired me." "Thank you brother for opening up to me...I cherish stories of your life, which you shared with me," he added.

99.title: BJP a Sultan in Delhi and TRS a Nizam in Hyderabad: Jairam Ramesh
99.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said the TRS in Telangana and BJP at the Centre are two sides of the same coin. "If you have a Sultan in Delhi, you have a Nizam in Hyderabad," said Ramesh. He added that the Bharat Jodo Yatra was also a message to the TRS to take the Voluntary Retirement Scheme (VRS).

100.title: 3 of family, including a police officer, drown in river in Kerala
100.article_body: Three members of a family, including an officer attached with the Special Armed Police, drowned in the Kallar river near Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The deceased, Firoz (31), his brother Abdul (36) and their sister's son Safan (16), lost their lives while trying to save their female relative who drowned first, police said. Later, the locals managed to save the girl.

101.title: Well played my friend: Yuvraj to SA's Rossouw on his 1st T20I ton vs India
101.article_body: Reacting to South Africa batter Rilee Rossouw's maiden T20I century against India in third T20I, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Well played my friend!!! You deserve this moment!!" He added, "Last two games have looked like stick cricket!! 4 6 4. 6 4 6! T20 is getting tough for bowlers in smaller grounds." Rossouw smashed an unbeaten 100 off 48 balls.

102.title: Khalistan Tiger Force operative arrested in Moga with grenades, pistols
102.article_body: The Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) unit of Moga Police in Punjab arrested an operative of the ISI-backed Khalistan Tiger Force (KTF). Hand grenades, pistols and ammunition smuggled in from Pakistan were recovered from the terrorist. The man is part of a terror module run by Canada-based Arshdeep Singh alias Arsh Dala, a close associate of KTF chief Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

103.title: 90% of all startups fail: Billionaire Anand Mahindra
103.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Over 90% of all startups fail." He explained, "Many fail because of one-off circumstances or because of poor risk management...Yet they had potentially viable models & good tech." He added, "That grey zone is a fertile field for large companies to plough." Recently, Mahindra Logistics acquired logistics startup Rivigo's B2B business for ₹225 crore.

104.title: Remaking a film is more challenging than doing original: Chiranjeevi
104.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi, speaking about 'GodFather', has said that remaking a film is more challenging than working on an original story. "Many of my remakes have earned more than their originals...my characters in those films have brought me great appreciation," he added. Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' is a remake of the 2019 Malayalam film 'Lucifer', which featured Mohanlal.

105.title: Stadium gates too small: Indonesian Police on last week’s stampede
105.article_body: Indonesian Police on Tuesday said the gates at the soccer stadium, where 125 people were killed in a stampede last Saturday, were too small. Only two people could pass through one gate at a time, police said. The probe was focusing on six of the total 14 gates where most deaths were recorded, police said.

106.title: Ukraine's war-torn economy will fall 35% this year: World Bank
106.article_body: The World Bank on Tuesday forecasted that the Ukrainian economy will fall 35% this year amid the ongoing invasion of the country by Russia. The bank expects the Ukrainian economy will return to growth in 2023, expanding by 3.3%. It further estimated that rebuilding Ukraine will cost at least $349 billion, i.e. 1.5 times the size of Ukraine's pre-war economy.

107.title: Chahar abuses Siraj for stepping on boundary line after taking catch, video viral
107.article_body: India pacer Deepak Chahar was spotted abusing Mohammed Siraj after the latter stepped on the boundary line after taking David Miller's catch in South Africa's innings in the third T20I. Siraj's error of judgement brought Miller's third six in a row in the last over of the innings. Miller scored 19*(5) as South Africa put up a total of 227/3.

108.title: Janhvi Kapoor joins Akshay Kumar & Tiger Shroff in 'Bade...': Report
108.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has reportedly been cast alongside Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff in 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan'. A source stated, "After contemplating on getting the best possible cast for the script, the team has zeroed in on Janhvi to play the female lead alongside Tiger." The film will be directed by Ali Abbas Zafar.

109.title: IMF to consider Ukraine’s emergency funding appeal: Officials
109.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) will consider Ukraine's appeal for additional emergency funding of $1.3 billion, officials told Reuters news agency. IMF staff believe Ukraine has received enough financial assurances from foreign partners to meet the debt sustainability requirement. If sanctioned, the funds are expected to address food shortages in the country.

110.title: Murali, Tejaswin real icons as they combine both academics, sports: Neeraj
110.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra said both long jumper Murali Sreeshankar and high jumper Tejaswin Shankar are the real icons as they have excelled in both sports and studies. "Though I excelled in sports, I couldn't give much attention to my studies...youth of this country should look upon you both," he added. Murali won CWG silver, while Tejaswin clinched bronze.

111.title: Gandhi family neutral regarding Congress Presidential polls: Kharge
111.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday claimed that Gandhi family is neutral regarding the party's upcoming Presidential polls. "Every section of Congress leaders asked me to contest this election. To strengthen the party and to save the Constitution of India, I agreed," Kharge said. Mallikarjun Kharge further said that this is an impartial election.

112.title: UP's Faizabad Cantt to be renamed as Ayodhya Cantt: Report
112.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has reportedly approved changing the name of Faizabad Cantonment in UP to Ayodhya Cantonment. The proposal for the name change came from the state government after last year the Faizabad Cantt railway station was renamed Ayodhya Cantt railway station. Earlier, in 2018, the entire district had been renamed Ayodhya district.

113.title: Kidnapped loan survey firm director rescued in Lucknow, 4 arrested
113.article_body: A 42-year-old director of a loan survey firm, who was allegedly kidnapped by a bank sales executive and his aides, was rescued by Lucknow Police on Monday night. Four persons were arrested in the case. The main conspirator, Ankur Tiwari, and his associates kidnapped the victim with the intention of using the ransom money to expand their business, police said.

114.title: South Africa record their highest-ever T20I total against India
114.article_body: South Africa on Tuesday recorded their highest-ever T20I total against India after registering 227/3 in their 20 overs in the third T20I in Indore. Rilee Rossouw top-scored for South Africa with 100* runs off 48 deliveries. South Africa's previous highest T20I total against India had come on Sunday, when they recorded 221/3 in Guwahati.

115.title: Electronics Mart India's ₹500-crore IPO subscribed 50% on Day 1
115.article_body: The ₹500-crore IPO of Electronics Mart India Ltd was subscribed 50% on the first day of the subscription on Tuesday. Retail investors reportedly subscribed 94% shares of the allotted quota, while the non-institutional investors bought 33% shares of the allotted quota. It received bids for 10.58 crore equity shares against an offer size of 6.25 crore equity shares, data showed.

116.title: CBI raids 105 locations in India against cyber criminals under 'Operation Chakra'
116.article_body: The CBI is carrying out searches at 105 locations in India under 'Operation Chakra' in action against cyber criminals. The operation is being carried out after inputs from the Federal Bureau of Investigation and Interpol, reports said. Raids reportedly took place in Delhi, Punjab, Karnataka, Assam and other states and ₹1.5 crore in cash and 1.5 kg gold were recovered.

117.title: PM Modi shares pics of AIIMS Bilaspur constructed at cost of ₹1,470 crore
117.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share pictures of AIIMS Bilaspur, which is constructed at a cost of ₹1,470 crore. PM Modi will inaugurate the facility in Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday. "I am glad that the AIIMS Bilaspur will be dedicated to the nation. It will ensure better healthcare facilities for people in the region," he wrote.

118.title: New Hindu temple with 16 deities to open from today in Dubai, pics surface
118.article_body: A new Hindu temple constructed in Jebel Ali in Dubai is set to open on Tuesday, one day ahead of Dussehra. The temple welcomes people of all faiths and has allowed entry to visitors to view the 16 deities and other interior works, reported Gulf News. According to the website, it will be open from 6:30 am to 8 pm.

119.title: India's 19-yr-old Mumtaz wins FIH women's 'Rising Star of the Year' award
119.article_body: India's Mumtaz Khan has been announced the International Hockey Federation's (FIH) 'Rising Star of the Year' for 2021-22 in the women's category. The 19-year-old forward was the best performer for India at FIH Junior Women's World Cup 2022, scoring eight goals in six matches. France's Timothée Clement has won the award in the men's category.

120.title: Deepak Chahar gives 'mankad' warning to South Africa batter, smiles at him; video goes viral
120.article_body: During the 16th over of South Africa's innings in the third T20I, Team India fast bowler Deepak Chahar stopped mid-way during his run-up seeing non-striker Tristan Stubbs leaving his crease. Chahar then warned Stubbs about 'mankading' and smiled at him. Notably, 'mankading' has been shifted from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out' in MCC rules effective October 1.

121.title: Match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 announced, only 1 Indian included
121.article_body: The ICC has announced 20 match officials (16 umpires and four match referees) for the first round and Super 12 stages of ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. Nitin Menon is the only match official from India to have been included. Marais Erasmus, Rodney Tucker and Aleem Dar will appear in their seventh ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

122.title: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' crosses ₹250 cr worldwide in 4 days
122.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' has crossed the ₹250-crore mark at the worldwide box office within four days of its release. The film was released in theatres across the globe in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada. 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' stars Vikram, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Trisha and Karthi, among others.

123.title: Was disheartened, 'Adipurush' meant for big screen: Director on trolling
123.article_body: Director Om Raut said that he was disheartened by people's reaction to the teaser of his upcoming film 'Adipurush'. "[I'm] not surprised because the film is made for...the big screen...Given a choice, I'd never put it on YouTube but that's the need of the hour," he added. Twitter users trolled the film's VFX after the teaser of 'Adipurush' was released.

124.title: PM Modi shares video of boy giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit
124.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared a video where a boy can be heard giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit. "This is heartening to see…Congrats to those undertaking this effort," the PM tweeted. The now-viral video shows few children playing cricket on a street. PM Modi also shared another video of a person giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit in Kashi.

125.title: Bajrang Dal activists barge into garba event in Guj, beat up bouncers
125.article_body: Some people said to be from Bajrang Dal barged into a garba event in Gujarat's Surat on Monday and attacked bouncers there. Two of the bouncers were injured in the incident. "We have deployed police staff at same garba event and extra police [force] has been deployed to prevent any untoward incident," the Deputy Commissioner said.

126.title: Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' to be screened at Busan Film Festival
126.article_body: Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram' will be screened at the 27th Busan International Film Festival. Turmeric Media, the co-producer of the film, took to Twitter to announce the screening. The film, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, also featured Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil. Busan International Film Festival will take place from October 5 to October 14.

127.title: Will take 4-5 yrs to resolve stubble burning: Punjab pollution control body
127.article_body: It will take four to five years to resolve the stubble burning issue in Punjab, a state Pollution Control Board official said. He added, "Crop diversification is not a long term solution because it does not mean that biomass will not be produced by other crops.'' Crop diversification is among several initiatives the Centre proposed to resolve stubble burning.

128.title: Jemimah, Deepti batted well to help us get back in the game vs UAE: Mandhana
128.article_body: Praising Jemimah Rodrigues(75*) and Deepti Sharma(64) following India's 104-run win against  United Arab Emirates at Women's Asia Cup, India stand-in skipper Smriti Mandhana said, "Jemimah and Deepti batted really well to help us get back in the game." Jemimah and Deepti added a 128-run fourth-wicket partnership after India were reduced to 20/3 inside the fifth over.

129.title: Viral photo from US shows windows that didn't shatter during Hurricane Ian
129.article_body: A photo showing windows that didn't shatter amid Hurricane Ian that hit US' Florida has gone viral. The photo is from Naples and it was shared by Dixie Whatley, who is a former TV journalist. It shows water reaching a great height outside her windows. However, the window panes didn't shatter and prevented the flood water from gushing in.

130.title: Empty poll promises have far-reaching ramifications: EC
130.article_body: The Election Commission told political parties that empty poll promises have far-reaching ramifications and that it can't overlook inadequate disclosures. The EC also asked political parties to provide authentic information to assess their financial viability and also to seek the views of the voters. The disclosure seeks to assess availability of the financial resources to implement the promises.

131.title: Kerala firm makes ₹5 crore profit by selling 7,382 tonnes of waste
131.article_body: Clean Kerala Company Limited (CKCL) has reported a profit of ₹5 crore by selling 7,382 tonnes of dry and recyclable waste. CKCL generated the profit within 20 months of launching operations in January 2021. It also collected and sold 1,972 tonnes of e-waste to recycling and processing units. CKCL is a joint venture of the state government and local bodies.

132.title: PM speaks with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, discusses ongoing conflict
132.article_body: PM Narendra Modi held a telephonic conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday and discussed the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. PM Modi reiterated his call for early cessation of hostilities and the need to pursue the path of dialogue and diplomacy. He said India attaches importance to the safety and security of nuclear installations, including in Ukraine.

133.title: Politically motivated: Sisodia on probe ordered by Delhi L-G
133.article_body: Responding to Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena's statement that they will probe irregularities in AAP's power subsidy scheme, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia called the orders "politically motivated, illegal and unconstitutional". Sisodia, in a letter to Saxena, said that the Delhi government has the right to make decisions in all fields except land, police, public order and services.

134.title: SphitiCap launches maiden early-stage fund of $500 mn
134.article_body: Venture Capital firm SphitiCap has launched its maiden early-stage fund with a $500 million corpus which it will invest in companies focusing on sustainability, growth and impact. SphitiCap was founded in 2022 and will invest an average of $10 million in Indian startups from the seed stage to Series A. It was founded by Pallav Kumar Singh and Mayank Mehra.

135.title: Container truck hits 3-wheeler vehicle in Gujarat; 5 killed, 4 injured
135.article_body: Five persons were killed and four others were injured after a container truck hit a three-wheeler ferrying passengers near Golden Chowki in Vadodara, Gujarat. The truck lost balance after hitting a car and jumped on the wrong side of the road after breaking the divider and crashed into the three-wheeler, police said. The truck was coming from Surat.

136.title: Himachal CM reviews preparations ahead of PM Modi's visit on Oct 5
136.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday reviewed arrangements and preparations ahead of PM Narendra Modi's programme in Bilaspur on October 5. PM Modi will inaugurate the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Bilaspur and lay the foundation stone for projects worth over ₹3,650 crore. "PM will also participate in Kullu Dussehra," CM Jairam Thakur said.

137.title: Video shows woman dancing to 'Kanta Laga' at Ramleela in UP; 10 booked
137.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a woman dancing to 'Kanta Laga' song at a Ramleela event in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal. A case has been registered against 10 members of the Ramleela committee, police said on Tuesday. The members have also been warned against indulging in any such action again, the Additional Superintendent of Police said.

138.title: Sara Ali Khan to play a freedom fighter in 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'
138.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram to announce that Sara Ali Khan will play the lead role in an upcoming film, titled 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'. He mentioned that Sara will play a freedom fighter in a fictional tale set against the backdrop of the Quit India Movement in 1942. The film will go on the floors this month.

139.title: Arjun Kapoor in talks to star in 'Pushpa: The Rule': Reports
139.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor is reportedly in talks to star in 'Pushpa: The Rule', the sequel to Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise'. According to reports, Arjun Kapoor may play the role of a police officer in the film. Actors Fahadh Faasil and Rashmika Mandanna will also return for the sequel, which will be directed by Sukumar.

140.title: Bengaluru hospital warns mothers their babies may get kidnapped: Report
140.article_body: New mothers in West Bengaluru's Vani Vilas government hospital are reportedly being told to "hold on to their babies at all times, otherwise, they might get kidnapped". Hospital staff especially nurses and security guards are warning the mothers. A medical officer reportedly said such 'announcements' are routine and take place in all hospitals.

141.title: Increase in tea prices to offset impact of wage rate hike: Report
141.article_body: An ICRA report said that an increase in tea prices following global supply issues will likely offset the impact of increased wage rates in West Bengal and Assam. ICRA said that overall financial performance will likely see a year-on-year improvement in FY23. The report said that orthodox tea prices are at all-time high due to production disruptions in Sri Lanka.

142.title: 3-year-old US water startup 'Liquid Death' valued at $700 million
142.article_body: Three-year-old US-based startup 'Liquid Death', which sells water in beer-style cans, is now valued at $700 million. It raised $70 million in its latest funding round led by Science Ventures, with participation from other investors including music group Swedish House Mafia and comedian Whitney Cummings. Its investors believe it's the fastest growing non-alcoholic beverage of all time.

143.title: UPI payments cross ₹11-lakh-crore mark in September 2022
143.article_body: Payments made through Unified Payments Interface (UPI) crossed the ₹11-lakh-crore mark in September 2022, as per National Payments Corporation of India's data. In September, 678 crore transactions, in volume terms, were carried out. As many as 657.9 crore transactions worth ₹10.72 lakh crore had taken place in August, up from 628.8 crore transactions worth ₹10.62 lakh crore in July.

144.title: Govt approves ₹26,000 crore to install 25,000 mobile towers in 500 days
144.article_body: According to a telecom ministry spokesperson, the government has approved ₹26,000 crore for installation of 25,000 mobile towers in 500 days. The spokesperson added that financial support for the project will be provided by Universal Services Obligation Fund. The project was announced by Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw at the recent 'Digital India Conference of State IT Ministers'.

145.title: TRS leader distributes liquor, live chicken ahead of launch of T'gana CM's new party
145.article_body: TRS leader Rajanala Srihari on Tuesday distributed liquor bottles and live chicken to public ahead of launch of new party by Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao. Srihari reportedly distributed about 200 bottles of alcohol and 200 chicken as part of the celebrations. A video showed a long queue waiting to receive liquor bottles and chicken from Srihari.

146.title: BSF seizes heroine from Pakistani truck in Amritsar
146.article_body: The BSF has seized 435 grams of heroin concealed in a Pakistani truck transporting dry fruits from Afghanistan at the Integrated Check-Post in Attari in Punjab's Amritsar district. The contraband was allegedly smuggled from Pakistan and was attached to an iron plate wrapped in black adhesive tape with a magnet to the back mud-guard, the BSF said.

147.title: BBMP to appoint 9 officers to handle floods, other disasters: Report
147.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will reportedly appoint nine disaster management officers to handle flood scenarios in the city. The BBMP already has one position for coordinator for disaster management, however, it is currently vacant. After floods affected the city in September this year, the BBMP now reportedly intends to create a special unit for catastrophe management.

148.title: Ear of Hindu priest chewed off during argument in Indore; 3 arrested
148.article_body: A Hindu priest's ear was chewed off, following an altercation with members of a family in Indore, MP. The family had invited the priest, Kunj Bihari Sharma,  to their house to perform a Puja where the incident happened, police said. Three persons, Lakshminarayan Sharma and his two sons Vipul and Arun, have been arrested in this connection.

149.title: Reliance, Sanmina sign deal to set up electronics manufacturing joint venture
149.article_body: Reliance Industries' subsidiary RSBVL and US-based Sanmina Corporation have completed the deal to set up an electronics manufacturing joint venture at a total enterprise valuation of about ₹3,300 crore. RSBVL will invest up to ₹1,670 crore in new shares in Sanmina's existing Indian entity. The day-to-day business will continue to be managed by Sanmina's management team in Chennai.

150.title: Russian who masterminded JEE 2021 paper leak sent to CBI custody
150.article_body: The Russian national who is said to be the mastermind behind the JEE (Mains) 2021 exam paper leak case was on Tuesday sent to CBI custody for two days by a Delhi court. The CBI informed the court that it will question the accused, Mikhail Shargin, about the data present in his phone, laptop and external hard disk.

151.title: Rahul was asked to request me to withdraw from Cong prez poll: Tharoor
151.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said on Tuesday that some party leaders had asked Rahul Gandhi to seek withdrawal of his candidature from Congress Presidential polls. "He told me he will not do so. He said I should not withdraw and that I should contest in the election," Tharoor said. Never expected big leaders to support me, Tharoor had earlier said.

152.title: Sony India-Zee Entertainment merger approved with modifications: CCI
152.article_body: Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Tuesday approved merger of Zee Entertainment Enterprises with Culver Max Entertainment, formerly known as Sony Pictures Networks. CCI said the merger was approved with "certain modifications". The firms have reportedly been asked by CCI to ensure they don't misuse market dominance resulting out of the merger. Zee and Sony had announced merger last year.

153.title: Will impose costs on perpetrators of violence in Iran: US Prez
153.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said his country will be "imposing further costs on perpetrators of violence against peaceful protestors" in Iran. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 21-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police over an "improper hijab". In a statement on Monday, Biden said, "We will continue holding Iranian officials accountable."

154.title: 20 killed, 36 wounded as al-Shabaab attacks Somali govt centre
154.article_body: Militant group al-Shabaab has attacked a government centre in Somalia's Hiran region, killing 20 people and injuring 36 others, officials said. Hirshabelle Health Minister and the Deputy Governor of Hiran were killed in the attack on Monday. The attack comes after the US said it had killed a top al-Shabaab leader in an airstrike in Somalia on October 1.

155.title: Jio to launch 5G trials in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Varanasi from tomorrow
155.article_body: Reliance Jio has announced that it will begin a beta trial of its 5G services in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Varanasi from October 5, 2022. Jio will allow users to experience 5G speeds of up to 1Gbps in these regions. The telecom operator said that it will conduct more 5G trials in other regions "as cities keep getting ready".

156.title: IAF has taken steps to deal with China at LAC: Air Chief Marshal
156.article_body: Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari said the Indian Air Force has taken "non-escalatory" measures to deal with Chinese activities along the LAC in eastern Ladakh. He added that they are prepared for all kinds of security challenges including "worst-case scenario". The Air Chief Marshal said the return to normal would happen only with a return to status quo ante.

157.title: India declares Hizb-Ul-Mujahideen commander Showkat Ahmad a terrorist
157.article_body: The Indian government on Tuesday declared the Chief Launching Commander of Hizb-Ul-Mujahideen, Showkat Ahmad Sheikh, a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 on charges of spreading terror violence in Jammu and Kashmir. Born in Baramulla, Showkat alias Showkat Mochi is based in Pakistan. Imtiyaz Ahmad Kandoo, another member of the outfit, has also been declared a terrorist.

158.title: EU, Israel hold 1st senior-level meeting in a decade
158.article_body: The European Union (EU) and Israeli representatives held senior-level talks on Monday, which is the first such meeting between the two sides in a decade. Ahead of the meeting, EU Diplomat Josep Borrell said the stalled Middle-East peace process and the situation in Palestine would be discussed. Quoting a United Nations report, he said the situation in Palestine was "worrisome''.

159.title: TRS leader distributes liquor, chickens ahead of launch of T'gana CM's new party
159.article_body: TRS leader Rajanala Srihari on Tuesday distributed liquor bottles and chickens to public ahead of launch of a new party by Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao. Srihari reportedly distributed about 200 bottles of alcohol and 200 chickens as part of the celebrations. A video showed a long queue waiting to receive liquor bottles and chickens from Srihari.

160.title: WWII reparations for Poland already settled: German Minister
160.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday said that Germany paying reparations for the World War II invasion of Poland was a matter already settled. A day earlier, Polish Foreign Minister Zbigniew Rau had signed an official document which sought around $1.3 trillion in reparations from Berlin. Baerbock said she had discussed the document in person with Rau.

161.title: No 'character certificate' required to cover PM's event: Himachal CM
161.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday withdrew the controversial order requiring a 'character certificate' of journalists to cover PM Narendra Modi's visit to the state on Wednesday. "I invite all journalists to cover PM's visit to the state on October 5," Thakur said, adding that PM will lay the foundation stone of various projects.

162.title: Films will make ₹4,000 cr if North & South come together: Salman Khan
162.article_body: Actor Salman Khan, speaking about North and South cinemas working together, said, "People talk about ₹300-400 crore, if we all get together, then we can cross ₹3,000-4,000 crore." Salman has a cameo in Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather'. "His (Chiranjeevi) fans go and watch me. My fans become his fans, his fans become my fans...everyone just grows...the numbers become very large," Salman added.

163.title: Man wears burqa to avoid money lenders in Mumbai, gets beaten
163.article_body: A man who wore a burqa to avoid money lenders was allegedly assaulted by a group of people on the suspicion of being a child-lifter in Mumbai. The incident took place on September 29, when the victim had gone to meet his brother in Dharavi. The man was saved from the group of people by Assistant Police Inspector Amol Chavhan.

164.title: Poland demands $1.3-trillion war reparations from Germany
164.article_body: Polish Foreign Minister Zbigniew Rau has signed an official document which seeks around $1.3 trillion in reparations from Germany for the World War II invasion of his country by the Nazis. Rau said the document will be sent to the Foreign Ministry of Germany. The development comes on the eve of German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock’s visit to Warsaw.

165.title: Bajaj Electronics IPO to remain open till October 7
165.article_body: The Initial Public Offering (IPO) of Electronic Mart India Limited, which operates outlets in the name of Bajaj Electronics, will remain open till October 7. The price band for a share of EMIL has been fixed ₹56-59. Out of the total lots, 50% is reserved for qualified institutional investors, 35% for retail investors, and 15% for non-institutional investors.

166.title: Jonny Bairstow reveals he broke his leg in 3 places in freak accident, shares pics
166.article_body: England wicketkeeper-batter Jonny Bairstow took to Instagram to give his followers an update on his injury and progress. The 33-year-old revealed that he broke his leg in three places and dislocated his ankle in a freak accident while playing golf last month. Sharing pictures, Bairstow added that he is now three weeks post surgery and his staples have been removed.

167.title: Singer Murali Mohapatra collapses and dies while performing on stage in Odisha
167.article_body: Odia singer Murali Mohapatra collapsed and died while performing at a Durga Puja cultural event in Odisha's Koraput district. Mohapatra, who was reportedly unwell, suddenly sat down on a chair on the stage after singing four songs. When taken to hospital, he was declared dead on arrival. He died of a heart attack late on Sunday night, his brother said.

168.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against South Africa, make 3 changes
168.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to field first against South Africa in the third T20I. India have made three changes to their playing XI. KL Rahul and Virat Kohli have been rested, while Arshdeep Singh misses out due to an issue with his back. They have been replaced by Shreyas Iyer, Mohammed Siraj and Umesh Yadav.

169.title: Wipro asks employees to come to office at least 3 days a week
169.article_body: Wipro's India offices will be open on Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays from October 10. The IT major said that it encourages employees to work from the office on at least three of these four days, Moneycontrol reported citing an e-mail from Wipro. "This will help us enjoy the camaraderie and team spirit of connecting in person," Wipro said.

170.title: I wanted to become a doctor: Ayushmann Khurrana
170.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who'll next be seen in 'Doctor G', revealed that he wanted to be a doctor. "I tried physics, chemistry, and bio in...11th and 12th...I've even given PMT exams, CBSE, PMT Karnataka CET, all these exams I'd gone through the drill," Ayushmann said, adding, "Not in real life, but at least I become a doctor in the film."

171.title: ED raids 12 Bengaluru entities over job scam involving Chinese citizens
171.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Monday conducted raids on 12 entities involved in a part-time job fraud case in Bengaluru and seized ₹5.85 crore from them. The raids were based on complaints that Chinese citizens had cheated people by collecting registration fees for part-time jobs. Police said the Chinese formed fake companies in India and recruited Indians to work for them.

172.title: Men who pelted stones at Guj garba event caned by police, video surfaces
172.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows police in Gujarat's Kheda district beating up two men accused of pelting stones during a garba event. In the video, the accused can be seen tied to a pillar and being beaten up by a wooden stick. Locals are seen applauding and cheering. The accused were taken to police station later.

173.title: Traffic constable gets 4 stitches after man slaps, hits him in Pune
173.article_body: A traffic constable received four stitches after a man assaulted him following a heated argument over parking his car in Pimpri Chinchwad near Pune. The accused reportedly slapped the constable and hit him on the face and head using his silver bangle (kada). Meanwhile, police have registered an FIR and arrested the accused.

174.title: Jemimah, Deepti's fifties help India beat UAE for 3rd straight win at Asia Cup
174.article_body: Jemimah Rodrigues' unbeaten 75-run knock and Deepti Sharma's 64 helped India defeat United Arab Emirates by 104 runs and win their third consecutive match at Women's Asia Cup 2022 on Tuesday. Opting to bat first, India put up a total of 178/5. UAE managed to score 74/4 in 20 overs. India are currently on top of the points table.
