349.article_body: Reacting to criticism of Pakistan's approach in their recent T20I matches, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said it's easy to say that Pakistan are "still playing old school cricket" and they should start playing "aggressively like Australia". "The current team has a way to play and in my opinion, there is nothing wrong in it," he stated.

350.title: Aus to set aside 30% of its land mass to protect endangered species
350.article_body: Australia will set aside at least 30% of its land mass to help protect plants and animals in the island continent famous for its rare species, Minister for the Environment and Water, Tanya Plibersek said. The State of the Environment Report released in July showed that Australia has one of the worst rates of species decline among world's richest countries.

351.title: Journalists covering PM Modi's event in Himachal asked to give 'character certificates'
351.article_body: In order to get security passes to cover PM Narendra Modi's visit to Himachal Pradesh tomorrow, journalists have been asked to produce a "certificate of their character verification". These include privately-owned print, digital and news television journalists, and representatives of the All India Radio and Doordarshan. Earlier, PM's September 24 visit to Mandi was cancelled over bad weather.

352.title: Cheetahs brought from Namibia not Nigeria: Scindia to Patole
352.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia reacted to Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole's allegation that Centre "deliberately" brought cheetahs to India from Nigeria to ensure the spread of lumpy skin disease and hurt farmers. Sharing Patole's video clip from the press conference, Scindia wrote, "Cheetahs were brought to India from Namibia, and not Nigeria Nana Patole Ji."

353.title: Everyone in country is laughing: BJP leader on Patole's 'cheetah' remark
353.article_body: Following Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole’s remark that Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to India to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP’s Mangal Prabhat Lodha said everyone in the country is laughing at his statement. Patole said, "Lumpy virus has been prevailing in Nigeria…cheetahs have also been brought from there."  Reacting to his remark, Lodha said, "Such observation is hilarious."

354.title: Fire breaks out at Ramlila pandal in UP's Etawah, no casualties reported
354.article_body: A fire broke out at a Ramlila 'pandal' due to a short circuit in UP's Etawah on Monday. No casualties or injuries were reported but the receipts of donations and some cash got burnt in the fire. The incident took place when the Ramlila stage was being prepared, police said. The fire was reportedly brought under control after 20 minutes.

355.title: We're both daughters of India: Priyanka Chopra tells US Vice President Kamala Harris
355.article_body: Priyanka Chopra recently interviewed US Vice President Kamala Harris and said, "I think we're both daughters of India, in a way." "You're a proud American-born daughter of an Indian mom and a Jamaican father. I'm an Indian born of two physicians as parents," the actress added. Priyanka was invited by the Democratic National Committee's Women's Leadership Forum to interview Harris.

356.title: New York City Mayor celebrates Durga Puja with Bengali community
356.article_body: New York City Mayor Eric Adams joined the Bengali community in Durga Puja celebrations in the city on Sunday. He was accompanied by New York City's Deputy Commissioner for International Affairs, Dilip Chauhan. "Durga Puja celebrates the triumph of good over evil. That's something we can all appreciate in these challenging times," Adam tweeted after attending the celebrations.

357.title: Sensex surges 1,200 points, Nifty above 17,200 as IT & bank stocks rally
357.article_body: The benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Tuesday, with the Sensex surging 1,236 points to 58,025 and the Nifty trading above 17,200 in opening trade. All the sectoral indices were trading in the green, led by Nifty IT and Nifty Bank. Hindalco Industries, IndusInd Bank, Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports and L&T were among major gainers on the Nifty.

358.title: Odia tribal man's hand, foot chopped off for demanding wage in UP
358.article_body: A 45-year-old tribal man's hand and foot were allegedly chopped off for demanding payment for his work at a cement factory in Uttar Pradesh in September. The victim, who hails from Odisha, said he was promised ₹20,000 a month but when he sought compensation, he was given two pouches of local liquor, after drinking which he fell unconscious.

359.title: Election Commission of India makes actor Pankaj Tripathi its 'national icon'
359.article_body: The Election Commission of India made actor Pankaj Tripathi its 'national icon' on Monday afternoon. The actor was chosen for 'his association with ECI in creating awareness amongst voters'. Chief Election Commissioner, Rajiv Kumar, said that the decision to make Tripathi the national icon was done keeping in view his commitment to the cause and wide appeal across the country.

360.title: 4 Indian-origin people including 8-month-old baby kidnapped in US
360.article_body: An eight-month-old girl and her parents were among four people abducted from Merced County in California on Monday, authorities said. Merced County Sheriff's Office said that 36-year-old Jasdeep Singh, 27-year-old Jasleen Kaur, their eight-month-old baby Aroohi Dheri along with 39-year-old Amandeep Singh were taken against their will by an armed and dangerous suspect.

361.title: Ousted Burkina Faso military ruler Damiba in Togo after coup
361.article_body: Togo's government on Monday said Burkina Faso's ousted military ruler has arrived in Togo after rival officers seized power in a coup on Friday. Togo had taken in Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba for the sake of regional peace, it added. Damiba, who came to power in a coup last January, formally resigned on Sunday following an agreement with new junta.

362.title: Woman waves gun while dancing at an event in Bihar; video surfaces
362.article_body: A video of a woman waving a gun while dancing at an event in Bihar's Siwan has surfaced online. While some reports claimed that the woman brought the gun for protection, other reports claimed that she was handed over the gun by one of the men dancing with her. Notably, celebratory firing at public gatherings is a criminal offence.

363.title: SoftBank-backed Automation Anywhere raises $200 million in funding
363.article_body: US-based robotic process automation company Automation Anywhere has secured $200 million in a funding round from Silicon Valley Bank, SVB Capital, and Hercules Capital. The SoftBank-backed company was co-founded by Mihir Shukla, Neeti Mehta Shukla, Ankur Kothari and Rushabh Parmani in 2003. Automation Anywhere had earlier raised $290 million in a funding round led by Salesforce Ventures.

364.title: 35-yr-old man buying balloons in TN market dies as helium tank explodes
364.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed while he was buying balloons in a busy market street in Tamil Nadu. He died after a helium tank used to inflate balloons exploded in the market area. Reports said that several vehicles were damaged in the blast and people started running in all directions when the blast took place.

365.title: 6 injured in stone pelting during Navratri in Gujarat's Kheda
365.article_body: Six people were injured during Navratri celebrations in Gujarat's Kheda, said police. The incident occurred on Monday night when a group led by two people named Arif and Zahir started creating a disturbance, added police. "All the accused are being identified and strict action will be taken. Police have been deployed in the village," said Kheda DSP Rajesh Gadhiya.

366.title: Presented Brahmastra at international studio summit, met Kevin Feige: Ayan
366.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said that he presented 'Brahmastra' at an international studio summit in Los Angeles where Disney had sent him. "I met Kevin Feige there and it was wonderful," he said, adding, "Astraverse plan came to life as we were bringing 'Brahmastra Part One' to life. I didn't always have this word Astraverse in mind when we first started."

367.title: 30 Delhi govt school principals to get training at Cambridge University
367.article_body: Around 30 principals from Delhi government schools and education department officials will be heading to the University of Cambridge, UK, for a leadership training programme next week, government officials said. The school principals will get leadership training for eight days at the university. "This will help us develop student-centric assessment practices," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

368.title: South Korean internet firm Naver to buy US e-commerce site Poshmark
368.article_body: South Korean internet firm Naver on Tuesday said that it will acquire Poshmark, a US apparel resale platform firm, in a $1.6 billion deal. Naver will acquire all of the issued and outstanding shares of Poshmark for $17.90 in cash. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of next year,  subject to approval by Poshmark stockholders.

369.title: India reports 1,968 new COVID-19 cases; lowest daily rise since May
369.article_body: India reported 1,968 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This is the lowest daily rise in the number of fresh COVID-19 cases since May. The active cases in the country now stand at 34,598, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,716.

370.title: Deepak Chahar one of the reasons why SA couldn't win in 2nd T20I: Nehra
370.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra has praised Deepak Chahar for his performance in the second SA T20I, stating that the 30-year-old was one of the reasons why the visitors couldn't chase down India's 238-run target. "He showed great variations which were tough for the batters to put away," added Nehra. Deepak conceded 24 runs in his four overs in the game.

371.title: F*** off is my very diplomatic reply: Ukrainian diplomat to Musk on plan to end war
371.article_body: Ukraine's outgoing ambassador to Germany Andrij Melnyk responded after the world's richest person Elon Musk proposed a plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine and suggested elections be held in annexed regions. "F*** off is my very diplomatic reply to you," Melnyk told Musk on his Twitter poll. "Now no Ukrainian will ever buy your f...ing Tesla crap," he added.

372.title: 40 arrested after communal clash between 2 groups in Gujarat's Vadodara
372.article_body: Gujarat Police arrested 40 persons after a communal clash broke out between two groups in Vadodara's Savli on Monday. "A Muslim festival is coming up...a local group tied their religious flag on an electronic pole. There is a temple nearby," police said. "Clash broke out after another local group went to convey how their religious sentiments were hurt," police added.

373.title: Robbers injure college student, snatch his gold ring in Pune
373.article_body: A second year B.Com student of Pune's Brihan Maharashtra College of Commerce was allegedly attacked by two knife-wielding men at Hanuman Tekdi. The victim, 19-year-old Varun Gupta, suffered injuries on his hand in the incident, while the attackers snatched away his gold ring. The victim was with his friends when the incident occurred, said police.

374.title: There's no other player whose absence means so much than Bumrah: Gavaskar
374.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said pacer Jasprit Bumrah's absence from India's squad will hurt them "considerably" in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "There's no other player in the Indian team, with due respect to every other player, whose absence means so much than Bumrah," stated Gavaskar. "With a bit of luck, [Arshdeep & Deepak] can fill in," he added.

375.title: Liquor sale banned for 2 days in parts of Bengaluru for Dussehra
375.article_body: In view of Dussehra celebrations, the Bengaluru Police have prohibited the sale of liquor in certain areas of the city for two days. The prohibition orders have been issued in north, east, north-east and central Bengaluru from 7 am on Wednesday (October 5) to 12 pm on Thursday (October 6), the Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy said.

376.title: Russian journalist who called Putin 'killer' listed as wanted fugitive
376.article_body: Former Russian state television journalist Marina Ovsyannikova was on Monday put on Moscow's wanted list after her ex-husband reported she had escaped from pre-trial house arrest. The 44-year-old was placed under house arrest in August after she held a lone protest in July near the Kremlin carrying a banner calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "killer" and his soldiers "fascists".

377.title: Vodafone in talks with CK Hutchison's Three for possible merger in UK
377.article_body: Vodafone is in talks with Three UK, a carrier owned by CK Hutchison, for a possible merger. In a statement, Vodafone said that the envisaged transaction would involve both companies combining their UK businesses, with Vodafone owning 51% and CK Hutchison owning 49% of the combined business. The deal would not involve any cash consideration, Vodafone said.

378.title: Shammi Kapoor would have killed it if he could be on Instagram: Riteish
378.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh said that if late actor Shammi Kapoor could have been on Instagram, he would have killed it. "I think Shammi Kapoor sahaab...was one of the first people who were on the internet in India and he loved technology...And [imagine] the kind of flamboyance if it was Shammi sahaab on these platforms available in the 60s," he added.

379.title: Prashant Kishor is working on behalf of BJP: JD(U) chief
379.article_body: JD(U) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh on Monday said that poll strategist Prashant Kishor is working "on behalf of BJP". "Kishor may give whatever name he chooses to his campaign but it does appear that he is working on behalf of the BJP. The type of publicity he is paying for raises the suspicion," Singh added.

380.title: Donald Trump sues CNN for defamation, seeks $475 million in damages
380.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has filed a lawsuit against CNN, accusing the TV network of defaming him. CNN ran a "campaign of dissuasion in the form of libel and slander", which recently escalated "as CNN fears [Trump] will run for president in 2024", he claimed. Trump is seeking $475 million in damages for causing him "humiliation and mental anguish".

381.title: Told him I'll take rain check: Ratnam on Rajinikanth's interest in 'Ponniyin..'
381.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam said that superstar Rajinikanth may have lightly mentioned his interest in being a part of  'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. "I can't just bring in a superstar, I have to be honest to the story. So I told him (Rajinikanth) [that] I will take a rain check with him about that," he added.

382.title: Cocaine worth ₹9.8 crore seized at Mumbai airport, passenger arrested
382.article_body: Mumbai airport customs on Monday seized 980 grams of cocaine worth ₹9.8 crore from a passenger who arrived from Ethiopia's capital, Addis Ababa. According to the customs, the contraband was concealed in the undergarments. The accused has been arrested and remanded to judicial custody.

383.title: Al-Shabaab terrorist with $3 mn bounty killed in US airstrike in Somalia
383.article_body: The US military said it had killed a leader of the al-Shabaab militant group in an airstrike in Somalia. The airstrike was carried out near Jilib in coordination with Somalia's government on October 1, it added. Abdullahi Nadir had a $3 million bounty on his head by the US. Nadir's "death is a thorn removed from the...nation", Somali government said.

384.title: 2 salespersons steal jewellery worth ₹8.10 lakh from shop in Pune
384.article_body: Two salespersons working at a jewellery shop in Pune were arrested for allegedly stealing gold and diamond ornaments worth ₹8.10 lakh. According to police, the accused initially stole one ornament for making quick money and then continued doing so as no staff suspected them. The police have recovered some of the stolen gold ornaments.

385.title: BMC sets aside ₹790 crore for 1st phase of Mumbai's beautification work
385.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has set aside ₹790 crore funds for the first phase of Mumbai's beautification plan which will include illumination and developmental work across the city. The civic body has allocated a total of ₹1,700 crore as part of this beautification plan which will be spent in phases over the course of the next three months.

386.title: 3 arrested for duping 50 people of ₹4-5 cr in loan fraud case in Pune
386.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested three persons in a loan fraud case for cheating at least 50 persons of ₹4-5 crore. The accused allegedly collected loan documents and a token amount of ₹2-3 lakh from each applicant, police said. "The accused did not have any licence for lending business nor did they have a tie-up with a financial institute," police added.

387.title: AAP to burn Ravan effigies made of garbage in 3,500 locations across Delhi
387.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will burn effigies of Ravan made of garbage at about 3,500 locations in Delhi today as a protest against BJP's "failure" to maintain cleanliness in national capital, the Arvind Kejriwal-led party said. AAP will hold protests after burning effigies and call for municipal polls to be held "at the earliest", AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak said.

388.title: Rana Daggubati receives golden bust of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar, shares pic
388.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati received a golden bust of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar. Sharing a picture of the same on Twitter on Monday, he wrote, "The most beautiful memory came into my office today. Miss you my friend." Puneeth Rajkumar passed away aged 46 in October last year after suffering a heart attack.

389.title: J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia found dead with slit throat, police look for domestic help
389.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Prisons Hemant Lohia was found dead at his house on Monday night. A murder probe has been launched while the suspect, his domestic help, is absconding. Lohia's domestic help reportedly first suffocated him to death, then slit his throat with a broken ketchup bottle and later attempted to set the body ablaze.

390.title: Shimron Hetmyer dropped from West Indies' T20 World Cup 2022 squad after missing flight
390.article_body: Batter Shimron Hetmyer has been dropped from West Indies' squad for T20 World Cup 2022 after missing his flight to Australia. Hetmyer missed his re-scheduled flight to Australia, which had been changed to Monday from Saturday at his request, due to family reasons. Hetmyer has been replaced by Shamarh Brooks in the squad.

391.title: India's unemployment rate drops to 6.43% in September, lowest in 4 years
391.article_body: India's unemployment rate fell to the lowest in over four years in September to 6.43%, according to data revealed by the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy. The rate is the lowest since August 2018 as compared to this year's high of 8.3% in August. The decline was reported as close to 10 million jobs were added during September.

392.title: People warned to take shelter in Japan as N Korea fires missile; it lands in Pacific Ocean
392.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday fired an intermediate-range ballistic missile over Japan, forcing the country to alert residents in northeastern regions to evacuate to shelters. Japan said the missile flew over Japan and is believed to have landed into the Pacific Ocean. This was Japan's first 'J-alert' alert since 2017, when North Korea fired a Hwasong-12 missile over the nation.

393.title: 33-yr-old accused of killing constable in Delhi riots arrested in UP
393.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested from UP's Aligarh for allegedly killing head constable Ratan Lal during the 2020 Delhi riots. The accused, identified as Mohammed Wasim, was declared a "proclaimed offender" by the Delhi High Court, police said. Apart from Lal, the then Shahdara DCP Amit Sharma and then ACP Gokalpuri Anuj Kumar had also sustained severe injuries, police stated.

394.title: Hyderabad Metro launches facility to let commuters book tickets on WhatsApp
394.article_body: The Hyderabad Metro Rail has launched the facility to book tickets on WhatsApp. Commuters will be able to purchase e-tickets on their WhatsApp number. They will be required to send a 'Hi' message to Hyderabad Metro Rail on a number. An OTP will then be sent to the commuters along with an e-ticket booking link.

395.title: BBMP Chief Commissioner files identity theft complaint for 2nd time
395.article_body: For the second time in three months, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath filed a police complaint against fraudulent use of his identity. The suspect chatted with people known to Nath using his display picture on WhatsApp and sent them requests for Amazon gift cards and links for purchases, said police.

396.title: Hyd man pours fuel on his bike, sets it ablaze after being stopped by police
396.article_body: A man poured fuel on his motorcycle and set it on fire after police stopped him for traffic offence. Reports said he was stopped as he was moving in the wrong direction on the road. Traffic police alerted the local law and order police, who arrived and extinguished the fire. Police said that the man is a regular traffic offender.

397.title: Zelenskyy starts poll on Musk after his 'Ukraine-Russia peace' plan, billionaire replies
397.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy started a Twitter poll on Elon Musk after the billionaire asked Twitter users to vote on a plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine. "Which @elonmusk do you like more?" Zelenskyy tweeted, with the options - one who supports Ukraine and one who supports Russia. Responding to it, Musk wrote, "I still very much support Ukraine."

398.title: SpaceX spent $80 million out of its pocket for Ukraine, $0 for Russia: Musk
398.article_body: Elon Musk has said that SpaceX's out-of-pocket cost to support Ukraine has been $80 million so far. "Our support for Russia is $0. Obviously, we are pro Ukraine," he added. His tweet came after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took a poll asking people which Musk they like more, the one who supports Ukraine or the one who supports Russia.

399.title: Riots engineered by US, Israel: Iran's Ayatollah on protests over woman's death
399.article_body: In his first public comments on the civil unrest stemming from 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death in Iranian police custody, supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said, "This rioting was planned." He added, "These riots and the insecurity were engineered by America and the occupying, false Zionist regime [Israel], as well as their paid agents." He said Amini's death "broke our hearts".

400.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook meets Pope Francis in private meeting at Vatican
400.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook was granted a "private audience" with Pope Francis at the Vatican on Monday. However, the Vatican did not disclose what was discussed between the two during the meeting. Cook had previously met the Pope in 2016. The Pope earlier warned people against becoming slaves to mobile phones and other forms of technology.
